item.description:
Hi Everyone,

I am assuming the weather will be OK enough based on the current predictions ?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We will be on the sandy point area as in the picture above

for the Beach Day..

 

Pot-luck BBQ is Nearby ---  if the weather looks real good for the weekend.

We will discuss this after our day at the Beach when planning to head out, not enough details at this time.

Anticipate Ninigret but may have another option to be discussed at the Paddle event.

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Paddling This  river will lead us up and through the NARROWS to the Dunes Beach area for a day in the water and on the sand.

You can surf the water in your boat or just use your body, then enjoy the day on the beach.

You have to have some ability to navigate the tide change current on this river.

Only Whimps complain and cry but they too can make it if we dangle some food in front of them for incentive.

 

WEATHER at the SITE:

http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=41.43304321031468&lon=-71.44138696289065

TIDE AT THE BEACH : http://tides.mobilegeographics.com/locations/4050.html

EXPECTED TIDE CURRENT AT THE BOAT RAMP AND ON THE RIVER: apx 2 hour lead/lag based on above: I see we will be riding with the tidal current  *out and back*  so that's an interesting condition for us... ok NO dangling of food up in front for the Whimps this time.

Every person can paddle this river even if you have a bathtub sized kayak but  you have to be determined to paddle it. Just think it will make your arms firmer and chest bigger but will make your ass a bit smaller in the process.

However there is a WHIMP put in spot closer to the Dunes Beach area at rte 1a, (You are on your own if you go there).

We will be fairly easy to spot on the beach or in the water.

See those interested at the event.

al-r

 

-------------------------------

Driving Directions:

Just use your GPS (By now everyone should have one @ $50 -$100 each -- its only 2 or 3 "Outings" worth of Booze at some Happy Hour event, but you can take an empty beer bottle and "Spin the Bottle" as your compass) or use mapquest /equivalent.

The Meetup Map link at the top of the Event Listing page seems to be OK so use that for a visual or directions.

-----------------------------------------------

KAYAKS AVAILABLE:

The following Kayaks with paddles and life jackets are available for the put in site if reserved in advance:

Note: if you reserve a kayak and i take it all the way to the site and you do not show -- you will never join us again for any event, these are my personal hobby boats and its asked you be sincere in showing up besides i ask less than half of what a local shop charges and you get better equipment right at the event site.

I only bring the boats reserved prior to me heading out in the morning.

OR SPECIFICALLY FOR THIS EVENT YOU HAVE TO RESERVE BY THURSDAY NIGHT OR FRIDAY "EARLY" MORNING, I WILL NOT BE HOME AFTER THAT AND NO INTERNET TILL SUNDAY NIGHT. IF its nice weather and YOU DON'T SHOW, Bye.

Yes i will understand  traffic may cause you to be late and if i hear of of any traffic via my GPS or by other arriving members, then we usually wait a bit longer than normal.

Please get a GPS, or a GPS with traffic data is even better.

 

 

Boat use Doughnation is $20.00.

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide.

This is an expedition style sea kayak designed for rough sea conditions and heavy loads.

Highly stable (initial & secondary), heavy weight (52 LB).       
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

RESERVED FOR MARION

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.    http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=706

Reserved.

 

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak,  Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=702

RESERVED FOR LINDA

 


KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version

(Very Thin Fibreglass), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit.

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

RESERVED FOR FELICIA



KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull, heavy weight (50 lbs).

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED.

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm .

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

RESERVED FOR KAREN

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro,  Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide,  heavy weight 50 lb

Greenland style sea kayak. Medium sized paddler (150-180 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat.

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

RESERVED FOR MR MEAT MAN

 

See those that are interested at the boat ramp or beach when you get there.

 

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: i will be wearing my Orange Hunting Hat at the boat ramp area.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: SEP 15 -- Kayak From the NARROW RIVER Wakefield to DUNES CLUB BEACH Narragansett
